intro: Diteilis rheedei, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Diteilis rheedei is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
